metadata.Title: CVE-2020-3341 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A vulnerability in the PDF archive parsing module in Clam AntiVirus(ClamAV) Software versions 0.101 - 0.102.2 could allow an unauthenticated,remote attacker to cause a denial of service condition on an affecteddevice. The vulnerability is due to a stack buffer overflow read. Anattacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted PDF file toan affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the ClamAVscanning process crash, resulting in a denial of service condition.

criterions.comment: clamav: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
